com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVUIController

  • @Controller
public class TEVUIController
extends Object
    Controller for all UI (HTML pages / jQuery-enabled) for the TEV application.
    Author:
    tiyb

    • Method Detail

      • index

        @RequestMapping(value={"/","/index"},
                method=GET)
public String index(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                      @RequestParam(value="tempBlogName")
                                                                                      Optional<String> blogParam)
        Returns the main (or index) page, at either / or /index. Checks first to see whether any metadata has been created; if not, redirects to the settings page.
        Parameters:
        model - not used
        blogParam - Specifies a blog to use, if other than the default
        Returns:
        name of the template to be used to render the page

      • conversations

        @RequestMapping(value="/conversations",
                method=GET)
public String conversations(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="tempBlogName")
                                                                                                Optional<String> blogParam)
        Returns the page for showing a list of message conversations, at /conversations. Retrieves metadata and conversations, which are added to the model, before returning the location of the conversations viewer.
        Parameters:
        model - not used
        blogParam - Specifies a blog to use, if other than the default
        Returns:
        name of the template to be used to render the page

      • metadata

        @RequestMapping(value="/metadata",
                method=GET)
public String metadata(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Returns the a page for maintaining the application's metadata, at /metadata. If no blogs have been created (i.e. if there are no Metadata objects in the DB), the model is updated with this info, so the client can create one.
        Parameters:
        model - not used
        Returns:
        name of the template to be used to render the page

      • individualMetatada

        @RequestMapping(value="/metadata/{blogName}",
                method=GET)
public String individualMetatada(@PathVariable(value="blogName")
                                                                                                           String blogName,
                                                                                                           org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Returns the page for maintaining metadata for a particular blog
        Parameters:
        blogName - Name of the blog being edited
        model - Used for setting the theme
        Returns:
        Name of the template to be used to render the page

      • addBlogNameJSToModel

        private void addBlogNameJSToModel(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                  String blogName)
        Helper function to add an attribute to the Model for a client-side bit of JS code for setting a variable with the blog's name. This should have been as simple as setting an attribute with the blog's name and then setting the JS code in the Thymeleaf page, but for some reason the initial developer couldn't figure out a way to get single quotes into the generated string...
        Parameters:
        model - The Model to which the JS code should be added
        blogName - The name of the current blog

      • addPostIdJSToModel

        private void addPostIdJSToModel(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                String postID)
        Helper function to add an attribute to the Model for a client-side bit of JS code for setting a variable with the post's ID. This should have been as simple as setting an attribute with the value and then setting the JS code in the Thymeleaf page, but for some reason the initial developer couldn't figure out a way to get single quotes into the generated string...
        Parameters:
        model - The Model to which the JS code should be added
        postID - The ID of the current post

      • handlePostFileUploadForBlog

        @PostMapping(value="/postDataUpload/{blog}")
public String handlePostFileUploadForBlog(@PathVariable(value="blog")
                                                                                       String blog,
                                                                                       @RequestParam(value="file")
                                                                                       org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file,
                                                                                       org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Handles file uploads, for reading in the Tumblr Post XML Export for a given blog. Actual logic is handled by the parseDocument() method; this method simply calls that class and then (upon success) redirects to the index. Failure redirects to the "bad XML" error page.
        Parameters:
        blog - The blog for which post data should be uploaded
        file - The Tumblr XML file to be read
        redirectAttributes - not used
        Returns:
        The page to which the successful upload should be redirected

      • handleConversationFileUpload

        @PostMapping(value="/conversationDataUpload/{blog}")
public String handleConversationFileUpload(@PathVariable(value="blog")
                                                                                                String blog,
                                                                                                @RequestParam(value="conversationFile")
                                                                                                org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file,
                                                                                                org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Handles file uploads for reading in Tumblr messaging XML extract. Actual logic is handled by the parseDocument() method; this method simply calls that class and then (upon success) redirects to the index. Failure redirects to the "bad XML" error page.
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which conversation should be uploaded
        file - the XML file to be parsed
        redirectAttributes - not used
        Returns:
        The page to which the application should be redirected after upload

      • showViewer

        @RequestMapping(value="/postViewer/{blog}",
                method=GET)
public String showViewer(@PathVariable(value="blog")
                                                                                                 String blog,
                                                                                                 @RequestParam(value="id")
                                                                                                 String postID,
                                                                                                 org.springframework.ui.Model model)

        This request is used to populate the viewer. It first determines the correct viewer to show (Regular, Photo, etc.), populates the Model (since the pages are rendered by Thymeleaf on the server rather than jQuery on the client), then returns the correct template to show that type of post.

        pullOutTagValues(String) is leveraged for getting a nicer view of the tags in the post.

        Parameters:
        blog - The blog for which this post should be retrieved
        postID - The ID of the post to be viewed (regardless of type)
        model - The model to be populated with post data, for use by Thymeleaf in the HTML template
        Returns:
        The name of the template to use for rendering the output

      • showHashtagViewerForBlog

        @RequestMapping(value="/hashtagViewer",
                method=GET)
public String showHashtagViewerForBlog(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam(value="tempBlogName")
                                                                                                           Optional<String> blogParam)
        This request is used to populate the hashtag viewer.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be populated with post data, for use by Thymeleaf in the HTML template
        blogParam - Optional: the name of the blog for which this page should be rendered, regardless of the default
        Returns:
        The name of the template to use for rendering the output

      • showExportViewer

        @RequestMapping(value="/exportViewer",
                method=GET)
public String showExportViewer(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="tempBlogName")
                                                                                                  Optional<String> blogParam)
        This request is used to view the XML for export purposes.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be populated with post data, for use by Thymeleaf (in this case, just theme information)
        blogParam - Blog to use, if other than the default
        Returns:
        The name of the template to use for rendering the output

      • showStagedPosts

        @RequestMapping(value="/staged",
                method=GET)
public String showStagedPosts(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                           @RequestParam(value="tempBlogName")
                                                                                           Optional<String> blogParam)
        This request is to show the Staged Post viewer
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be populated with a list of IDs, for use by Thymeleaf
        blogParam - Blog to use, if other than the default
        Returns:
        The name of the template to use for rendering the output

      • showConversationViewer

        @RequestMapping(value="/conversationViewer",
                method=GET)
public String showConversationViewer(@RequestParam(value="blog")
                                                                                                              String blog,
                                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="participant")
                                                                                                              String participantName,
                                                                                                              org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Request used to populate conversation viewer
        Parameters:
        blog - Name of the blog
        participantName - Name of the conversation
        model - Populated with information from this conversation
        Returns:
        Name of the viewer to load

      • getMedia

        @RequestMapping(value="/viewerMedia/{imageName}",
                method=GET,
                produces={"image/jpeg","image/gif","image/png"})
 @ResponseBody
public byte[] getMedia(@PathVariable(value="imageName")
                                                                                                                                                                                     String imageName,
                                                                                                                                                                                     org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Returns a binary image, for use in the viewer. HTML pages can't directly access local images or videos, so this has to be done via the "server."
        Parameters:
        imageName - Name of the image to be retrieved
        model - not used
        Returns:
        Byte stream of the file, as loaded from the file system

      • getVideo

        @RequestMapping(value="/viewerVideo/{videoName}",
                method=GET,
                produces="video/mp4")
public void getVideo(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                                                                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns a binary video, for use in the viewer. HTML pages can't directly access local images or videos, so this has to be done via the "server."
        Parameters:
        response - HTTP Response object
        request - HTTP Request object

      • getStagedPostsFileForBlog

        @RequestMapping(value="/stagedPostsDownload/{blog}",
                method=GET,
                produces="text/plain")
 @ResponseBody
public String getStagedPostsFileForBlog(@PathVariable(value="blog")
                                                                                                                                                                               String blog,
                                                                                                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                                                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Used to request the XML export, for any posts that have been "staged" for export. Returns the data as a string, with the intent that it is displayed in the browser.
        Parameters:
        blog - The blog for which staged downloads should be retrieved
        response - The HTTP Response object (used for setting headers)
        request - The HTTP Request object
        Returns:
        The XML file, as a String

      • footer

        @RequestMapping(value="/footer",
                method=GET)
public String footer(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Retrieves the application version number from the application's POM, adds it to the model, then returns the "footer" page.
        Parameters:
        model - For setting the application version, used by Thymeleaf
        Returns:
        name of the template to be used to render the page

public String header(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Returns the header
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • viewerButtons

        @RequestMapping(value="/viewerbuttons",
                method=GET)
public String viewerButtons()
        Returns the viewer buttons used in all post viewer pages
        Returns:
        name of the template to be used to render the page

      • pullOutTagValues

        private String pullOutTagValues(String csvTags)
        Helper method that pulls out the tags into spans. This kind of ties processing together with UI, but... whatever.
        Parameters:
        csvTags - String containing the hashtags, separated by commas
        Returns:
        String, containing HTML span tags containing the hashtags

      • updateModelWithTheme

        private void updateModelWithTheme(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Used to set the theme, so that Thymeleaf pages can set the correct CSS
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be updated
